name: Great Barrier Reef
desc: The Great Barrier Reef is one of the 7 Natural Wonders of the world. It is larger than Switzerland, Holland and the United Kingdom combined. A habitat for rare and threatened species of plants and animals, it is protected by the Australian government and it one of the World Heritage Sites. It is home to a diverse range of marine life and is the worlds largest reef system.
check: The Great Barrier Reef is the world's largest living organism.

name: Denali
desc: Denali is the highest mountain peak in North America, with a summit elevation of 20,310 feet above sea level.
check: In August 2015, with President Barack Obama's approval, the U.S. Department of the Interior officially renamed the mountain Denali.

name: Taj Mahal
desc: The Taj Mahal, 'Crown of the Palace', is an ivory-white marble mausoleum on the southern bank of the river Yamuna in the Indian city of Agra.
check: The name Taj Mahal means “crown of palaces”. Construction of the Taj Mahal took around 20 years, beginning around 1632 and finishing around 1653. The Taj Mahal is made of white marble.

name: La Sagrada Familia
desc: The Basílica de la Sagrada Família, also known as the Sagrada Família, is a large unfinished Roman Catholic minor basilica in the Eixample district of Barcelona, Catalonia, Spain
check: Together with six other buildings in Barcelona, part of la Sagrada Família is a UNESCO World Heritage Site, as testifying to its exceptional creative contribution to the development of architecture.

name: The Great Wall
desc: The Great Wall of China is the collective name of a series of fortification systems generally built across the historical northern borders of China to protect and consolidate territories of Chinese states and empires against various nomadic groups.
check: A comprehensive archaeological survey, using advanced technologies, has concluded that the walls built by the Ming dynasty measure 8,850 km (5,500 mi).

name: Eiffel Tower
desc: The Eiffel Tower is a wrought-iron lattice on the Champ de Mars in Paris. It is named after the engineer Gustave Eiffel.
check: For 41 years, the Eiffel Tower stood higher than any building or structure in the world—until it was surpassed by the Chrysler Building in New York, which topped out at 1046 feet.

name: Angkor
desc: Angkor was the capital city of the Khmer Empire. The city and empire flourished from approximately the 9th to the 15th centuries.
check: Angkor Wat is spread across over 400 acres / 1.6 km², and is said to be the largest religious monument in the world.

name: Victoria Falls
desc: Victoria Falls is a waterfull on the Zimbabwe River in Southern Africa, which provides habitat for several unique species of plants and animals.
check: It is located on the border between Zambia and Zimbabwe and is considered to be one of the world's largest waterfalls due to its width of 1,708 metres.

name: St. Basil's Cathedral
desc: Denali is the highest mountain peak in North America, with a summit elevation of 20,310 feet above sea level.
check: Built around the 156-foot high central nave are nine small, separate that are aligned to points on the compass, four of which are raised to designate their position between heaven and earth.
